intro: Macleania rotundifolia, commonly known as the wax plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its waxy, silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
